SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Levels

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.Levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
Challenge, LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Observable
The abstract class representing a level in the game. It handles the main game mechanics such as managing the player, enemies, projectiles, collisions, and the game loop.

The class extends Observable to allow observers to be notified of changes, such as when the level is completed.

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth, GameController controller)
      Constructor for initializing the game level with essential components.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - the background image for the level
      screenHeight - the height of the screen
      screenWidth - the width of the screen
      playerInitialHealth - the initial health of the player
      controller - the game controller to handle game actions

      Checks if an enemy unit has penetrated past the player's defenses.
      Parameters:
      enemy - the enemy unit to check
      Returns:
      true if the enemy has penetrated, false otherwise

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      Ends the game with a win state, stopping the game loop and displaying a win message.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      Ends the game with a loss state, stopping the game loop and displaying a game over message. A retry button is also displayed to allow the player to retry the level.

    • loseChallenge

      protected void loseChallenge()
      Handles the loss of a challenge, displaying the scoreboard and allowing the player to retry the level.

      protected void updateUserShieldPosition()
